abstract:
A code ${\cal C}$ is $\Z_2\Z_4$-additive if the set of coordinates can
be partitioned into two subsets $X$ and $Y$ such that the punctured code
of ${\cal C}$ by deleting the coordinates outside $X$ (respectively,
$Y$) is a binary linear code (respectively, a quaternary linear code).
In this paper $\Z_2\Z_4$-additive codes are studied. Their corresponding
binary images, via the Gray map, are $\Z_2\Z_4$-linear codes, which seem
to be a very distinguished class of binary group codes. As for binary
and quaternary linear codes, for these codes the fundamental parameters
are found and standard forms for generator and parity check matrices are
given. For this, the appropriate inner product is deduced and the
concept of duality for $\Z_2\Z_4$-additive codes is defined. Moreover,
the parameters of the dual codes are computed. Finally, some conditions
for self-duality of $\Z_2\Z_4$-additive codes are given.
